verses.verse: So Aaron said, “Do not let the anger of my lord become hot. (Ex. 14:11; Deut. 9:24) You know the people, that they are set on evil.
For they said to me, ‘Make us gods that shall go before us; as for this Moses, the man who brought us out of the land of Egypt, we do not know what has become of him.’
And I said to them, ‘Whoever has any gold, let them break it off.’ So they gave it to me, and I cast it into the fire, and this calf came out.”
Now when Moses saw that the people were (Ex. 33:4, 5) unrestrained (for Aaron (2 Chr. 28:19) had not restrained them, to their shame among their enemies),
then Moses stood in the entrance of the camp, and said, “Whoever is on the LORD’s side—come to me!” And all the sons of Levi gathered themselves together to him.

And he said to them, “Thus says the LORD God of Israel: ‘Let every man put his sword on his side, and go in and out from entrance to entrance throughout the camp, and (Num. 25:5-13) let every man kill his brother, every man his companion, and every man his neighbor.’ ”
So the sons of Levi did according to the word of Moses. And about three thousand men of the people fell that day.

(Ex. 28:41; 1 Sam. 15:18, 22; Prov. 21:3; Zech. 13:3) Then Moses said, “Consecrate yourselves today to the LORD, that He may bestow on you a blessing this day, for every man has opposed his son and his brother.”

Now it came to pass on the next day that Moses said to the people, (1 Sam. 12:20, 23) “You have committed a great sin. So now I will go up to the LORD; (2 Sam. 16:12) perhaps I can (Num. 25:13) make atonement for your sin.”
Then Moses (Deut. 9:18) returned to the LORD and said, “Oh, these people have committed a great sin, and have (Ex. 20:23) made for themselves a god of gold!
Yet now, if You will forgive their sin—but if not, I pray, (Ps. 69:28; Is. 4:3; Mal. 3:16; Rom. 9:3) blot me (Dan. 12:1; Phil. 4:3; Rev. 3:5; 21:27) out of Your book which You have written.”
And the LORD said to Moses, (Lev. 23:30; (Ezek. 18:4; 33:2, 14, 15)) “Whoever has sinned against Me, I will (Ex. 17:14; Deut. 29:20; Ps. 9:5; Rev. 3:5; 21:27) blot him out of My book.

Now therefore, go, lead the people to the place of which I have (Ex. 3:17) spoken to you. (Ex. 23:20; Josh. 5:14) Behold, My Angel shall go before you. Nevertheless, (Deut. 32:35; Rom. 2:5, 6) in the day when I visit for punishment, I will (Ps. 89:32) visit punishment upon them for their sin.”
So the LORD plagued the people because of (Neh. 9:18) what they did with the calf which Aaron made.

(The Command to Leave Sinai) Then the LORD said to Moses, “Depart and go up from here, you (Ex. 32:1, 7, 13; Josh. 3:17) and the people whom you have brought out of the land of Egypt, to the land of which I swore to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, saying, (Gen. 12:7) ‘To your descendants I will give it.’

(Ex. 32:34; Josh. 5:14) And I will send My Angel before you, (Ex. 23:27-31; Josh. 24:11) and I will drive out the Canaanite and the Amorite and the Hittite and the Perizzite and the Hivite and the Jebusite.
Go up (Ex. 3:8) to a land flowing with milk and honey; for I will not go up in your midst, lest (Num. 16:21, 45) I consume you on the way, for you are (Ex. 32:9; 33:5) a stiff-necked people.”
And when the people heard this bad news, (Num. 14:1, 39) they mourned, (Ezra 9:3; Esth. 4:1, 4; Ezek. 24:17, 23) and no one put on his ornaments.

For the LORD had said to Moses, “Say to the children of Israel, ‘You are a stiff-necked people. I could come up into your midst in one moment and consume you. Now therefore, take off your ornaments, that I may ((Ps. 139:23)) know what to do to you.’ ”
So the children of Israel stripped themselves of their ornaments by Mount Horeb.

(Moses Meets with the LORD) Moses took his tent and pitched it outside the camp, far from the camp, and (Ex. 29:42, 43) called it the tabernacle of meeting. And it came to pass that everyone who (Deut. 4:29) sought the LORD went out to the tabernacle of meeting which was outside the camp.
So it was, whenever Moses went out to the tabernacle, that all the people rose, and each man stood (Num. 16:27) at his tent door and watched Moses until he had gone into the tabernacle.
And it came to pass, when Moses entered the tabernacle, that the pillar of cloud descended and stood at the door of the tabernacle, and the LORD (Ex. 25:22; 31:18; Ps. 99:7) talked with Moses.
